metadata.title: USN-5750-1 -- GnuTLS vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that GnuTLS incorrectly handled certain memory operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause GnuTLS to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5750-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libgnutls30 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 libgnutls28-dev - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 libgnutlsxx28 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 gnutls-doc - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 libgnutls-dev - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 gnutls-bin - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 guile-gnutls - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.4.10-4ubuntu1.9+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
